JobFullDesc:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. 
General Counsel’s Organization:
 
  
Where great legal minds influence global business strategy.
 
  
 
Our mission is to protect and strengthen American Express through legal expertise and strategic advice that helps our business partners manage risk, identify opportunities, and deliver on the company’s promise of exceptional products and services. Given the dynamic nature of the global payments industry and the valued partnership between our team and the business, we see it as imperative to attract and develop talented people by:
 
Providing rich work experiences and opportunities for professional development
Recognizing and rewarding those who drive and deliver results
Respecting and valuing diversity, integrity, and personal accountability  
  
 
Role & Responsibilities:
 
Help propel your team and its business partners to success.  
 
This position will provide legal advice and support to the business as follows:
 
 
Provide legal advice and support to all American Express legal entities in Mexico (“AMEX”), for all the business strategies and launching of new products and/or projects or commercial alliances
Design and oversee the company’s policy and position on legal matters
Support to different line of business within the company on different topics (corporate card services, acquiring, payment aggregators, real estate, travel business)
Protect the company against legal risks and violations
Verify governance practices are consistent and meet or exceed regulatory standards
Create or support the implementation of legal strategies
Legal analysis of new regulation or amendments to existing regulation, applicable to AMEX, identifying main impacts to inform and implement them in timely manner
Guide management on regulatory and compliance issues and coordinate efforts to comply with local legislation and support compliance of internal policies
Experience negotiating contracts with third party vendors, intercompanies
Negotiate, review, draft and analyze contracts to be executed by AMEX, with clients, third party vendors, intercompanies, business partners, etc.
Maintain and improve relations with regulators (CONDUSEF, PROFECO, etc.)
Review marketing materials to verify its compliance with local regulation
Work across local and global teams on priority projects related to acquiring business model and other financial services
 • Experience as in-house lawyer in financial institutions & in a wide range of corporate matters
 
• Experience in corporate, consumer, financial, commercial and data privacy regulation
 
• Agile legal analysis and decision making
 
• Energetic and creative problem-solver with superior interpersonal skills
 
• Effective interaction with business lines and regulators
 
• Efficient and agile regulatory analysis and implementation
 
• Must be flexible, detail-oriented, and able to prioritize competing deadlines
 
• Leadership skills / communication, decision making, goals orientation & problem solving
 
• Bachelor’s degree in Law (specialization or master degree´s desirable)
 
• Experience as in-house lawyer in financial institutions
 
• Excellent communication skills, both verbal and writing
 
• Team player, use to work in very demanding environments
 
• Adaptation to change
 
• Business/Legal English verbal and writing
Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.
